data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3162012,"name":"rmeesters","username":"rmeesters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rmeesters/{size}/66357_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-11T00:45:02.753Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eOur lead mentor would like to see if we can use a Rev through bore encoder on our arm pivot point, with our current Falcon/MotionMagic setup to move to position. It looks like this may be possible using this definition to configure the sensor, but I’m a little stuck with finding references on how to define the feedback device as the through bore sensor.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003earmPivot.configSelectedFeedbackSensor(FeedbackDevice.PulseWidthEncodedPosition, loopIDX, timeoutMS);\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAny help would be appreciated.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2023-03-11T00:45:02.753Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":186,"reads":118,"readers_count":117,"score":953.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":429777,"topic_slug":"use-a-rev-through-bore-encoder-with-ctre-motionmagic","display_username":"rmeesters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29955,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/use-a-rev-through-bore-encoder-with-ctre-motionmagic/429777/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3172741,"name":"","username":"Von_Speedwagon","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/85f322/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-25T14:41:32.676Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI’m going to assume that you are using an AC motor for this.
